characteristic: a typical feature or quality that something/somebody has
trait: a particular quality in your personality
apprehensive: worried or frightened that something unpleasant may happen
assertive: expressing opinions or desires strongly and with confidence, so that people take notice
clumsy: (of people and animals) moving or doing things in a very awkward way
cynical: not believing that something good will happen
desirable: that you would like to have or do; worth having or doing
eccentric: a person who is considered by other people to be strange or unusual
egotistical: thinking that you are better or more important than anyone else
gullible: too willing to believe or accept what other people tell you and therefore easily tricked
inconsiderate: not giving enough thought to other people’s feelings or needs
indecisive: (of a person) unable to make decisions
self-assured: having a lot of confidence in yourself and your abilities
self-absorbed: only concerned about or interested in yourself
self-centered: tending to think only about yourself and not thinking about the needs or feelings of other people
self-congratulatory: praising yourself or saying how well you have done something
self-deprecating: done in a way that makes your own achievements or abilities seem unimportant
self-important: thinking that you are more important than other people
tactful: careful not to say or do anything that will annoy or upset other people
well-adjusted: reasonable and has good judgment and their behaviour is not difficult or strange
well-bred: having or showing good manners; typical of a high social class
well-brought-up: People, especially children, who are well-br_____ht-up are polite and act in a quiet and pleasant way, because they have been taught this behaviour at home
era: a period of time, usually in history, that is different from other periods because of particular characteristics or events (thời đại, kỷ nguyên)
evolution: (biology) the gradual development of plants, animals, etc. over many years as they adapt to changes in their environment
find: a good or valuable thing or a special person that has been discovered but was not known about before
pioneer: a person who is one of the first people to do something
remnant: a part of something that is left after the other parts have been used, removed, destroyed, etc.
in retrospect: thinking about a past event or situation, often with a different opinion of it from the one you had at the time
status quo: the situation as it is now, or as it was before a recent change
transition: the process or a period of changing from one state or condition to another
trend: a general direction in which a situation is changing or developing
abrupt: sudden and unexpected, often in an unpleasant way
bygone: happening or existing a long time ago
moderate: that is neither very good, large, hot, etc. nor very bad, small, cold, etc.
preceding: existing or happening before someone or something
prehistoric: connected with the time in history before information was written down
profound: very great; felt or experienced very strongly
rapid: happening in a short period of time,
topical: connected with something that is happening or of interest at the present time
turbulent: in which there is a lot of sudden change, confusion, disagreement and sometimes violence
there aren't enough hours in the day: There are too many things to do and not enough timecó quá nhiều việc để làm mà không có đủ thời gian
excavate: to dig in the ground to look for old buildings or objects that have been buried for a long time
behaviour: the way that somebody behaves, especially towards other people
demographics&nbsp;: data relating to the population and different groups within it
heritage: the history, traditions and qualities that a country or society has had for many years and that are considered an important part of its character
interaction: the act of communicating with somebody, especially while you work, play or spend time with them
minority: the smaller part of a group; less than half of the people or things in a large group
norm: standards of behaviour that are typical of or accepted within a particular group or society
peer: a person who is the same age or who has the same social status as you
pressure: difficulties and feelings of anxiety that are caused by the need to achieve or to behave in a particular way(áp lực)
segment: a part of something that is separate from the other parts or can be considered separately
standard: a level of quality, especially one that people think is acceptable
status: the situation at a particular time during a process
anti-social: harmful to societyoften avoiding spending time with other peoplecó hại cho xã hộihay xa lánh người khác
conservative: opposed to great or sudden social change; showing that you prefer traditional styles and values
conventional: ending to follow what is done or considered acceptable by society in general(theo tập quán, theo tục lệ, theo tiêu chuẩn thông thường)
harmonious: arranged together in a pleasing way so that each part goes well with the others (hài hòa, cân đối)(of relationships, etc.) friendly, peaceful and without any disagreement (hòa thuận, hòa hợp)
influential: having a lot of influence on somebody/something
multicultural: for or including people of several different races, religions, languages and traditions
suburban: in or connected with a suburb
unconventional: not following what is done or considered normal or acceptable by most people; different and interesting
follow accepted behaviour: tuân theo hành vi được cho phép
conform: to behave and think in the same way as most other people in a group or society
exclude: to deliberately not include something in what you are doing or considering
flaunt: to show something you are proud of to other people, in order to impress them
obey: to do what you are told or expected to do
skew: to change or influence something with the result that it is not accurate, fair, normal, etc.
capsule: a small container with medicine inside that you swallow
carbon dioxide: a gas breathed out by people and animals from the lungs or produced by burning carbon
compound: a substance formed by a chemical reaction of two or more elements in fixed amounts relative to each other
consequence: a result of something that has happened
dose: an amount of a medicine or a drug that is taken once, or regularly over a period of time
emission: gas, etc. that is sent out into the air
exposure: the fact of experiencing something or being affected by it because of being in a particular situation or place
food chain: a series of living things that are connected because each group of things eats the group below it in the chain
infection: the act or process of causing or getting a disease
pesticide: a chemical used for killing pests, especially insects
protein: one of the many substances found in food such as meat, cheese, fish, or eggs, that is necessary for the body to grow and be strong
reaction: phản ứng (về thái độ, hoặc về hóa học)
side effect: tác dụng phụ, tác dụng không mong muốn
bacterial: caused by or connected with bacteria
contagious: a co_______us disease spreads by people touching each other
controversial: causing a lot of angry public discussion and disagreement
crucial: extremely important, because it will affect other things
essential: completely necessary; extremely important in a particular situation or for a particular activity
organic: produced by or from living things
petrochemical: any chemical substance obtained from petroleum oil or natural gas
absorb: to take in a liquid, gas or other substance from the surface or space around
apprenticeship: a period of time working as an apprentice; a job as an apprentice(sự học việc, sư học nghề; thời gian học việc, thời gian học nghề)
conceptualize: to form an idea of something in your mind(hình dung về một cái gì đấy)
consistency: the quality of always behaving in the same way or of having the same opinions, standard, etc.(sự
establishment: the act of starting or creating something that is meant to last for a long time
formulation: the activity of creating or preparing something(sự tạo thành, sự hình thành)
inconsistency: a situation in which two things do not match and are opposed
insignificance: the fact of not being big or valuable enough to be considered important
technician: a worker trained with special skills, especially in science or engineering
theorist: someone who develops ideas about the explanation for events
vocation: a type of work or way of life that you believe is especially suitable for you
analytical: using a logical method of thinking about something in order to understand it, especially by looking at all the parts separately(dùng phép phân tích)
blue-collar: connected with people who do physical work in industry
conceptual: related to or based on ideas
hypothetical: imagined or suggested but not necessarily real or true
indicative: (of something) (formal) showing or suggesting something(tỏ ra, ra ý, ngụ ý, biểu lộ, biểu thị)
a process of trial and error: a way of achieving an aim or solving a problem by trying a number of different methods and learning from the mistakes that you make(quá trình giải quyết vấn đề bằng cách thử đi thử lại nhiều lần, rút kinh nghiệm dần dần)
give yourself something to aim for: tự đặt cho mình một mục tiêu để phấn đấu
make a concerted effort: done in a planned and determined way, especially by more than one person, government, country, etc.
billboard: a large board on the outside of a building or at the side of the road, used for putting advertisements on(bảng quảng cáo, panô quảng cáo)
branding: the activity of giving a particular name and image to goods and services so that people will be attracted to them and want to buy them(hoạt động tạo thương hiệu cho một sản phẩm)
distributor: a person or company that supplies goods to shops/stores, etc.(nhà phân phối sản phẩm)
flyer: a small sheet of paper that advertises a product or an event and is given to a large number of people(tờ rơi, tờ bướm quảng cáo)
gimmick: an unusual trick or unnecessary device that is intended to attract attention or to persuade people to buy something(chiêu trò, mánh lới tiếp thị)
jingle: a short song or tune that is easy to remember and is used in advertising on radio or television
manufacturer: a person or company that produces goods in large quantities(nhà sản xuất, đơn vị sản xuất)
marketing: the activity of presenting, advertising and selling a company’s products or services in the best possible way
ploy: words or actions that are carefully planned to get an advantage over somebody else
rebate: an amount of money that is returned to you, especially by the government, for example when you have paid too much tax(tiền bồi hoàn, tiền trả (sau thuế))
vendor: a person who sells things(người bán hàng, thường là trên đường phố)
catchy: (of music or the words of an advertisement) pleasing and easily remembered(dễ nhớ, dễ thuộc (bài hát... ))
compelling: so strong that you must do something about it(hấp dẫn, thuyết phục)
distracting: taking your attention away from what you are trying to do(làm mất tập trung)
disturbing: making you feel anxious and upset or shocked(tạo cảm giác lo lắng, sợ hãi, hoặc sốc)
infuriating: making you extremely angry(làm điên tiết, chọc điên tiết)
invasive: moving into all areas of something and difficult to stop(có tính xâm lược, xâm chiếm, xâm lấn)
irritating: annoying, especially because of something somebody continuously does or something that continuously happens(làm phát cáu, chọc tức)
monetary: relating to the money in a country(liên quan đến tiền bạc)
persuasive: able to persuade somebody to do or believe something(có tài thuyết phục, có sức thuyết phục, khiến tin theo, khiến nghe theo)
promotional: connected with advertising(liên quan đến quảng cáo (để bán hàng))
slick: done or made in a way that is clever and efficient but often does not seem to be sincere or lacks important ideas(tài tình, khéo léo, có điều đôi khi không trung thực hoặc thiếu sâu sắc)
inevitable: that you cannot avoid or prevent (synonym: unavoidable)(không thể tránh được, chắc chắn xảy ra, bất khả kháng)
assure: to tell somebody that something is definitely true or is definitely going to happen, especially when they have doubts about it(làm cho vững tâm, làm cho tin chắc, quả quyết, cam đoan)
cultivate: to nurture and help grow(cày cấy, trồng trọt / trau dồi, tu dưỡng (trí tuệ... ))
entice: to persuade someone to do something by offering them something pleasant(dụ dỗ, cám dỗ, lôi kéo, nhử vào bẫy)
induce: (formal) to persuade or influence somebody to do something(xui, xui khiến, tác động khiến ai đó làm việc gì đấy)
pressurise: to strongly persuade someone to do something they do not want to do,
reassure: to say or do something that makes somebody less frightened or worried(trấn an, làm ai đó bớt lo lắng)
tempt: to attract somebody or make somebody want to do or have something, even if they know it is wrong(cám dỗ, quyến rũ, nhử, làm thèm, gợi thèm)
urge: to strongly advise or try to persuade someone to do a particular thing(thúc, thúc giục, giục giã /
breathtaking: extremely exciting, beautiful, or surprising(vô cùng hấp dẫn, ngoạn mục, bất ngờ)
charming: very pleasant or attractive(đẹp, duyên dáng, yêu kiều; có sức quyến rũ, làm say mê, làm mê mẩn)
comfortable: dễ chịu, thoải mái, khoan khoái
dramatic: (of a change, an event, etc.) sudden, very great and often surprising (đột ngột)exciting and impressive (kịch tích, gay cấn)exaggerated in order to create a special effect and attract people’s attention (cường điệu hóa để thu hút sự chú ý)
magnificent: extremely attractive and impressive; deserving praise(tráng lệ, nguy nga, lộng lẫy, ấn tượng, cừ khôi)
memorable: special, good or unusual and therefore worth remembering or easy to remember(đáng ghi nhớ, không thể quên được)
mountainous: having many mountains(có núi, lắm núi)
precarious: (of a situation) not safe or certain; dangerous(không chắc chắn, bấp bênh, mong manh; hiểm nghèo, gieo neo)
remote: far away from places where other people live(xa xôi, hẻo lánh, cách biệt)
rustic: simple and often rough in appearance; typical of the countryside(mộc mạc, quê mùa; đậm chất thôn quê)
spectacular: very impressive (synonym: breathtaking)(đẹp mắt, ngoạn mục)
attract: to pull or draw someone or something towards them, by the qualities they have, especially good ones(thu hút, hấp dẫn, lôi cuốn)
damage: to harm or spoil something(làm hư hại, làm hỏng, làm tổn thương, gây thiệt hại, gây tổn hại)
outweigh: to be greater or more important than something(có nhiều tác dụng hơn, có nhiều giá trị hơn, có nhiều ảnh hưởng hơn)
bureaucrat: an official working in an organization or a government department, especially one who follows the rules of the department too strictly(quan lại, công chức, người quan liêu)
civil servant: người làm trong lĩnh vực hành chính công
community: all the people who live in a particular area, country, etc. when talked about as a group(cộng đồng)
healthcare: the service of providing medical care(dịch vụ chăm sóc sức khỏe)
mayor: the head of the government of a town or city, etc., elected by the public(thị trưởng)
parliament: the group of people who are elected to make and change the laws of a country(quốc hội, nghị viện)
military service: a period during which young people train in the armed forces(thời gian tại ngũ, thời gian trong quân đội)
notion: an idea, a belief or an understanding of something(ý
old-age pension: a regular income paid by the state to people above a particular age(tiền lương hưu, tiền trợ cấp hưu trí)
safety net: an arrangement that helps to prevent disaster if something goes wrong(lưới an toàn (nghĩa bóng))
social services: a system that is organized by the local government to help people who have financial or family problems(dịch vụ xã hội)
unemployment benefit: money paid by the government to somebody who is unemployed(tiền trợ cấp thất nghiệp)
social welfare: services provided by the government or private organizations to help poor, ill, or old people(phúc lợi xã hội)
miscalculate: to estimate an amount, a figure, a measurement, etc. wrongly(tính sai, tính nhầm)
misinform: to give somebody wrong information about something(báo tin tức sai)
misdiagnose: to give an explanation of the nature of an illness or a problem that is not correct(chấn đoán sai, phán đoán sai)
mismanage: to deal with or manage something badly(quản lý kém, xử lý kém)
misunderstand: to fail to understand somebody/something correctly(hiểu nhầm)
misinterpret: to understand something/somebody wrongly(hiểu sai, giải thích sai)
mislead: to give somebody the wrong idea or impression and make them believe something that is not true(cố tình lừa dối, tạo ấn tượng giả với ai đó)
misjudge: to form an opinion or idea about someone or something that is unfair or wrong
mistrust: to have doubts about the honesty or abilities of someone
subsidize: to give money to somebody or an organization to help pay for something(trợ cấp, phụ cấp)
burrow: a hole or tunnel in the ground made by animals such as rabbits for them to live in(hang (cầy, thỏ))
colony: a group of plants or animals that live together or grow in the same place(động vật học) bầy, đàn, tập đoàn
deforestation: the act of cutting down or burning the trees in an area(sự phá rừng; sự phát quang)
degradation: the process in which the beauty or quality of nature is destroyed or spoiled(sự suy biến, sự thoái hóa của tự nhiên)
demise: the end of something that was previously considered to be powerful, such as a business, industry, or system(sự sụp đổ, suy vong, suy tàn)
devastation: great destruction or damage, especially over a wide area(sự tàn phá, sự phá huỷ, sự phá phách)
flooding: large amounts of water covering an area that is usually dry; the fact of this happening(sự làm ngập lụt; sự úng lụt; nạn lụt)
habitat: the place where a particular type of animal or plant is normally found(môi trường sống, nơi sống (của cây cối động vật))
harm: damage or injury that is caused by a person or an event(hại, tai hại, tổn hao, thiệt hại)
herd: a large group of animals of the same type that live and feed together(bầy, đàn)
hive: a structure made for bees to live in(tổ ong, đõ ong)
lifespan: the length of time that something is likely to live, continue or function(tuổi thọ)
pack: a group of animals that hunt together or are kept for hunting(đàn, bầy (chó săn, chó sói... ))
parasite: a small animal or plant that lives on or inside another animal or plant and gets its food from it(vật ký sinh / nghiã bóng: kẻ ăn bám)
prey: an animal, a bird, etc. that is hunted, killed and eaten by another
rival: a person, company or thing that competes with another in sport, business, etc.(đối thủ, địch thủ, người kình địch, người cạnh tranh)
swarm: a large group of insects, especially bees, moving together in the same direction(đàn, đám, bầy)
threshold: the level at which something starts to happen or have an effect(ngưỡng, mức, điểm bắt đầu, ngưỡng cửa (cả nghĩa đen và nghĩa bóng))
appalling: shocking; extremely bad(làm kinh hoảng, làm kinh sợ, làm kinh hãi, làm thất kinh; kinh khủng)
aquatic: growing or living in, on or near water(sống ở nước, mọc ở nước)
hypocritical: pretending to have moral standards or opinions that you do not actually have(đạo đức giả, giả nhân giả nghĩa; nói điều mà mình không thực sự tin)
impartial: not supporting one person or group more than another(công bằng, không thiên vị, vô tư)
irresponsible: (of a person) not thinking enough about the effects of what they do; not showing a feeling of responsibility(thiếu tinh thần trách nhiệm / không thận trọng, khinh suất)
nocturnal: (of animals) active at night(thuộc) đêm; về đêm
outrageous: very shocking and morally unacceptable(quá chừng, quá quắt)
risky: involving the possibility of something bad happening(liều, mạo hiểm / đấy rủi ro, đầy mạo hiểm)
flourish: to grow or develop successfully (thrive)(hưng thịnh, thịnh vượng, phát đạt; thành công; phát triển, mọc sum sê (cây... ))
forage: to go from place to place searching, especially for food(tìm kiếm, hái lượm thứ gì đó, đặc biệt là thức ăn)
hibernate: (of animals) to spend the winter in a state like deep sleep(ngủ đông (động vật))
lay: (of an animal or bird) to produce eggs from out of the bodyđẻ trứng (chim)
poach: to catch and kill animals without permission on someone else's land(săn trộm, câu trộm)
thrive: to become, and continue to be, successful, strong, healthy, etc.(thịnh vượng, phát đạt / lớn nhanh, mau lớn, phát triển mạnh)
condensation: hơi nước ngưng tụ / sự ngưng tụ, ngưng đọng
debris: pieces of wood, metal, brick, etc. that are left after something has been destroyed(vôi gạch đổ nát)
evaporation: the process of a liquid changing or being changed into a gas(sự làm bay hơi, sự bay hơi)
gravity: (Vật lý) Sự hút, sự hấp dẫn; trọng lực; trọng lượng
harbour: an area of water on the coast, protected from the open sea by strong walls, where ships can shelter(bến tàu, cảng / (nghĩa bóng) : nơi an toàn; nơi ẩn náu)
climatic: connected with the climate of a particular area(Thuộc) Khí hậu, (thuộc) thời tiết
fascinating: extremely interesting and attractive(làm mê, làm say mê, quyến rũ)
immeasurable: too large, great, etc. to be measured(vô hạn, mênh mông, không thể đo lường được)
imperceptible: very small and therefore unable to be seen or feltKhông thể cảm thấy; không thể nhận thấy /
magnetic: (thuộc) nam châm, có tính từ, (thuộc) từ
transient: lasting for only a short time; temporaryNgắn ngủi, nhất thời, chóng tàn /
vast: extremely large in area, size, amount, etc. (synonym: huge)Rộng lớn, mênh mông, bao la; to lớn ((nghĩa đen) & (nghĩa bóng))
activate: to make something such as a device or chemical process start workinghoạt hóa, làm hoạt động, kích hoạt
burst: to break open or apart, especially because of pressure from inside; to make something break in this waybùng nổ, nổ tung, vỡ tung / làm bủng nổ, làm vỡ tung
collide: (especially of moving objects) to hit something violentlyva nhau, đụng nhau
dilute: to make a liquid weaker by adding water or another liquid to itpha loãng, pha thêm nước, làm nhạt đi
dissolve: (of a solid) to mix with a liquid and become part of ithoà tan; làm tan ra.
penetrate: to go into or through somethingThâm nhập, lọt vào; nhìn xuyên qua.Đâm thủng, xuyên qua; nhìn xuyên qua (màn đêm... )
pierce: to make a small hole in something, or to go through something, with a sharp objectĐâm, chọc, chích, xuyên (bằng gai, bằng ghim... ).
reflect: to show the image of somebody/something on the surface of something such as a mirror, water or glassPhản chiếu, phản xạ, dội lại
repel: to drive, push or keep something awayđẩy, đẩy lùi, chống lại
solidify: to change from being a liquid or gas to a solid form, or to make something do thisĐặc lại, rắn lại, đông đặc /
cyberspace: the internet considered as an imaginary area without limits where you can meet people and discover information about any subjectthế giới mạng, không gian mạng
expense: the money that you spend on somethingSự tiêu; phí tổn
fabric: cloth or material for making clothes, covering furniture, etc.vải vóc
fibre: any of the thread-like parts that form plant or artificial material and can be made into clothxơ, sợi, thớ
foam: a soft material used to fill furniture and other objectsxốp
log: a thick piece of wood that is cut from or has fallen from a treeKhúc gỗ mới đốn, khúc gỗ mới xẻ
marble: a type of hard stone that is usually white and often has coloured lines in it.Đá hoa, cẩm thạch
patent: the official legal right to make or sell an invention for a particular number of yearsBằng sáng chế, bản quyền sáng chế
pillar: a strong column made of stone, metal, or wood that supports part of a buildingCột, trụ
plank: a long narrow flat piece of wood that is used for making floors, etc.Tấm ván gỗ
prop: a piece of wood, metal, etc. used to support something or keep it in positionCái chống, nạng chống
thread: a thin string of cotton, wool, silk, etc. used for sewing or making clothChỉ, sợi chỉ, sợi dây
timber: wood used for buildinggỗ làm nhà, cây gỗ
cutting-edge: at the newest, most advanced stage in the development of somethingtối tân
futuristic: extremely modern and unusual in appearance, as if belonging to a future time
demolish: to pull or knock down a buildingPhá huỷ; đánh đổ
dye: to change the colour of something, especially by using a special liquid or substancenhuộm
innovative: introducing or using new ideas, ways of doing something, etc.Có tính chất đổi mới; có tính chất là một sáng kiến.
revolve: to go in a circle around a central pointQuay tròn, xoay quanh
rotate: to move or turn around a central fixed point; to make something do thisQuay, xoay quanh
strike: to hit somebody/something hard or with forceĐánh, đập
archive: a collection of historical records relating to a place, organization, or familya place where historical records are keptTài liệu, tài liệu lưu trữ; lưu trữ; phòng lưu trữ
acquisitiveness: eagerness to own and collect thingsTính thích trữ của, tính hám lợi.
stockpile: a large amount of food, goods, or weapons that are kept ready for future useKho dự trữ
supplies: food and other ordinary goods needed by people every daynhu yếu phẩm hàng ngày
chic: the quality of being fashionable and elegant (synonym:
drab: dull and boring, especially in appearance; having little colour and excitementĐều đều, buồn tẻ, xám xịt.
mundane: not interesting or exciting (synonym: dull, ordinary)tầm thường, nhạt nhẽo; vô vị
sophisticated: having a lot of experience of the world and knowing about fashion, culture and other things that people think are socially importantkhôn ngoan, thông thái, thạo đời
must-have: something that many people want to ownthứ rất nhiều người muốn có
a passing trend: Something that used to be insanely popular for a while, and
conspicuous consumption: the situation in which you spend a lot of money on expensive goods in order to impress people and show them how rich you are(Kinh tế học) Sự tiêu dùng nhằm thể hiện; Sự tiêu dùng nhằm khoe khoang.
designer label: a famous company that makes expensive clothes, bags, etc. and that is a well-known brand
disposable income: the money that you can spend as you want and not the money that you spend on taxes, food, and other basic needs(Kinh tế học) Thu nhập khả dùng; thu nhập khả tiêu; Thu nhập khả dụng.
get rid of: to remove or throw away something unwantedtống khứ
abandon: to leave a place, thing, or person, usually for evertừ bỏ; bỏ rơi, ruồng bỏ
conserve: to keep and protect something from damage, change, or wasteGiữ gìn, duy trì, bảo tồn, bảo toàn
discard: to get rid of something that you no longer want or needBỏ, loại bỏ, vứt bỏ (quần áo, thói quen, lòng tin... )
dump: to get rid of something you do not want, especially in a careless wayĐổ thành đống (rác); vứt bỏ, gạt bỏ (ai...)Đổ ầm xuống, ném phịch xuống
eradicate: to destroy or get rid of something completely, especially something badnhổ tận gốc rễ,
hoard: to collect large amounts of something and keep it in a safe, often secret, placeTrữ, tích trữ; dự trữ; dành dụm
maintain: to continue to have; to keep in existence, or not allow to become lessGiữ, duy trì, bảo vệ, bảo quản
preserve: to keep something as it is, especially in order to prevent it from decaying or being damaged or destroyedGiữ, giữ gìn, bảo quản, bảo tồn, duy trì
retain: to keep something; to continue to have somethingVẫn giữ, vẫn có, vẫn duy trì, vẫn dùng, không bỏ
concrete jungle: a way of describing a city or an area that is unpleasant because it has many buildings and no trees or parksrừng bê-tông (một cách miêu tả khu vực đô thị)
housing estate: an area in which a large number of houses or flats/apartments are planned and built together at the same timekhu đô thị
slum: an area of a city that is very poor and where the houses are dirty and in bad conditionKhu nhà ổ chuột.
noise pollution: noise, such as that from traffic, that upsets people where they live or work and is considered to be unhealthy for themô nhiễm tiếng ồn
suburbs: an area where people live that is outside the centre of a citykhu vực ngoại ô, ngoại thành
sewage: the system of carrying away waste water and human waste from houses and other buildings through large underground pipes or passageshệ thống cống rãnh, mương thoát nước
congestion: the state of being crowded and full of traffictắc nghẽn (thường dùng để nói về giao thông)
urban sprawl: the spread of a city into the area surrounding it, often without planningào ạt vươn ra ngoại ô một cách thiếu quy hoạch
frantic: done or arranged in a hurry and a state of excitement or confusionĐiên cuồng, điên rồ, cuống cuồng
high-rise: (of a building) very tall and having a lot of floorsCao ngất (nhà nhiều tầng)
isolated: (of buildings and places) far away from any otherscô lập, biệt lập
overpopulated: (of a country or city) with too many people living in itquá tải dân số, quá đông dân
migrate: (of a lot of people) to move from one town, country, etc. to go and live and/or work in anotherDi trú, di cư; ra nước ngoài.
settle: to make a place your permanent homeLàm ăn, sinh sống; ổn định cuộc sống, an cư lạc nghiệp, định cư.
tranquil: calm and peaceful and without noise, violence, worry, etc.:Lặng lẽ, yên lặng, yên tĩnh; thanh bình.
abysmal: extremely bad or of a very low standardvô cùng tệ hại, thậm tệ
catastrophe: a sudden event that causes many people to suffer
clone: to produce an exact copy of somethingnhân bản, sao chép giống hệt
controversy: a lot of disagreement or argument about something, usually because it affects or is important to many peopleSự tranh luận, sự tranh cãi.
crisis: a time of great danger, difficulty or confusion when problems must be solved or important decisions must be madeSự khủng hoảng; cơn khủng hoảng.
dilemma: a situation in which a difficult choice has to be made between two different things you could do (synonym: predicament)Thế tiến lui đều khó, thế tiến thoái lưỡng nan, tình trạng khó xử.
disaster: (an event that results in) great harm, damage, or death, or serious difficulty (synonym: catastrophe)Tai hoạ, thảm hoạ, tai ách;
hurdle: a problem that you have to deal with before you can make progress (synonym: obstacle)(Nghĩa bóng) Vật chướng ngại.
obstacle: a situation, an event, etc. that makes it difficult for you to do or achieve something (synonym: hindrance)Vật chướng ngại, trở lực.Sự cản trở, sự trở ngại.
setback: something that happens that delays or prevents a process from developingMột trở ngại, khó khăn, thụt lùi.
catastrophic: causing a lot of damage and suffering;
daunting: making you feel slightly frightened or worried about your ability to achieve something (synonym: intimidating)Làm thoái chí, làm nản chí.
disastrous: very bad, harmful or unsuccessful (synonym: catastrophic, devastating)Tai hại, thảm khốc.Bất hạnh.
insurmountable: (of difficulties, problems, etc.) that cannot be dealt with successfully (synonym: insuperable)Không vượt qua được (vật chướng ngại... ).
ongoing: continuing to exist or developliên tục, vẫn đang diễn ra, vẫn đang tiếp tục diễn biến
pervasive: present or noticeable in every part of a thing or placeToả khắp.Lan tràn khắp, thâm nhập khắp.
problematic: difficult to deal with or to understand; full of problems; not certain to be successfulcó nhiều vấn đề khó khăn
do more harm than good: to be damaging and not helpfullợi bất cập hại, hại nhiều hơn lợi
dwell on: to keep thinking or talking about something, especially something that would be better to forgetDừng lại ở, chăm chú vào, nhấn lâu vào, day đi day lại, nói đi nói lại.
energy crisis: a shortfall in or interruption to the provision of energy supplieskhủng hoảng năng lượng
gain insight into: to have a clear and deep understanding of a complicated problem or situationhiểu thấu được bên trong sự vật, sự việc
take stock of something: to think carefully about a situation or event and form an opinion about it, so that you can decide what to do next(Nghĩa bóng) Nhận xét, đánh giá.
aggravate: to make a bad situation worse
alleviate: to make something less severe (synonym: ease)Làm nhẹ bớt, làm giảm bớt, làm đỡ, làm dịu, làm khuây (sự đau, nỗi đau khổ, nỗi phiền muộn).
arise: (especially of a problem or a difficult situation) to happen; to start to existXuất hiện, nảy sinh ra, xảy ra.Phát sinh do; do bởi.
exacerbate: to make something that is already bad even worse, especially a disease or problem (synonym: aggravate)Làm tiêu cực thêm, làm xấu đi, làm trầm trọng thêm (bệnh, sự tức giận, sự đau đớn).
hinder: to make it difficult for somebody to do something or for something to happen (synonym: hamper)Cản trở, gây trở ngại.
ignore: to pay no attention to somethingLờ đi, phớt đi, làm ra vẻ không biết đến; kệ, bỏ qua.
improve: to become better than before; to make something/somebody better than beforeCải tiến, cải thiện, cải tạo, trau dồi (tư tưởng), mở mang (kiến thức... ).
mitigate: to make something less harmful, serious, etc. (synonym: alleviate)Giảm nhẹ, làm dịu bớt, làm cho đỡ.
rectify: to put right something that is wrong (synonym : correct)Sửa, sửa cho thẳng.
resolve: to find an acceptable solution to a problem or difficulty (synonym: settle)Giải quyết (khó khăn, vấn đề, mối nghi ngờ...).
aftershock: a small earthquake that happens after a bigger one(Địa lý,địa chất) Dư chấn.
cattle: cows and bulls that are kept as farm animals for their milk or meatgia súc
coast: the land beside or near to the sea or oceanBờ biển.
deforestation&nbsp;: the act of cutting down or burning the trees in an areaSự phá rừng; sự phát quang.
desalination&nbsp;: the process of removing salt from sea waterSự khử muối từ nước biển.
erosion: the process by which soil, stone, etc. being gradually damaged and removed by the waves, rain, or windSự xói mòn, sự ăn mòn.
fungus: any of various types of organisms that get their food from decaying material or other living thingsnấm
herbivore: any animal that eats only plantsĐộng vật ăn cỏ.
lava: hot liquid rock that comes out of a volcano(Địa lý, địa chất) Lava, dung nham.
petal: a delicate coloured part of a flower.(Thực vật học) Cánh hoa.
productivity: Sức sản xuất; năng suất, hiệu suất.
puddle: a small amount of water or other liquid, especially rain, that has collected in one place on the groundVũng nước (mưa... ).
reservoir: a natural or artificial lake where water is stored before it is taken by pipes to houses, etc.Bể chứa nước; hồ dự trữ nước
shore: the land along the edge of the sea or ocean, a lake or another large area of waterbờ (biển, hồ)
stem: (Thực vật học) Thân (cây); cuống, cọng (lá, hoa).
tremor: a small earthquake in which the ground shakes slightlychấn động, rung động
current: the movement of water in the sea or a river; the movement of air in a particular directionthe flow of electricity through a wire, etc.Dòng (nước); luồng (gió, không khí); (điện học) dòng điện.
dense: having parts that are close together so that it is difficult to go or see throughDày đặc, chặt.Đông đúc; rậm rạp.
freezing: extremely coldGiá lạnh, băng giá, rét lắm.
long-term: that will last or have an effect over a long period of timeDài hạn, dài ngày, lâu dài.
native: (of animals and plants) existing naturally in a placebản địa, thuộc về một vùng đất nào đó
resistant: not affected by something; able to resist somethingCó sức chịu đựng, có sức bền, bền.
severe: extremely bad or seriousRất xấu, rất mãnh liệt, rất gay go, khốc liệt, dữ dội.
torrential: (of rain) falling in large amountsNhư thác, cuồn cuộn.
tropical: coming from, found in or typical of the tropics(Thuộc) Nhiệt đới.
a storm in a teacup: a lot of anger or worry about something that is not importantchuyện bé xé ra to
be snowed under with something: to have more things, especially work, than you feel able to deal withcó nhiều việc hơn mức có thể làm
every cloud has a silver lining&nbsp;: every sad or difficult situation has a positive sidebất cứ vấn đề xấu gì cũng đều có một mặt tốt trong đó
in the cold light of day: If you think about something in the cold light of day, you think about it clearly and calmly, without the emotions you had at the time it happened, and you often feel sorry or ashamed about itkhi đã bình tĩnh suy nghĩ lại (thường là cảm thấy ân hận hoặc xấu hổ)
see which way the wind is blowing: to get an idea of what is likely to happen before doing somethingsuy tính, dự đoán trước khi hành động
not have the foggiest idea: to not know anything at all about somethingkhông biết một chút gì về cái gì đó
the calm before the storm: a calm time immediately before an expected period of violent activity or argumentkhoảng lặng trước cơn bão
not a cloud in the sky: there are no longer any problems, or all the bad things have gone away.
vicious circle: a situation in which one problem causes another problem which then makes the first problem worsetình huống mà thứ A tạo ra thứ B, rồi thứ B lại làm thứ A mạnh lên, khiến tình huống càng ngày càng tệ đi
weather the storm: If someone or something w_______r the st___m, they successfully deal with a very difficult problem
breed: to keep animals for the purpose of producing young animals in a controlled wayGây giống; chăn nuôi.
flow: (of liquid, gas or electricity) to move steadily and continuously in one directionchảy, chạy
sow: to plant or spread seeds in or on the groundgieo hạt
biofuel: fuel made from plant or animal sources and used in enginesnhiên liệu sinh học
carbon footprint: a measure of the amount of carbon dioxide that is produced by the daily activities of a person or companydấu chân cacbon (tổng lượng khí thải từ các hoạt động thường ngày của mỗi cá nhân)
consumption: the act of using energy, food or materials; the amount usedSự tiêu thụ, sự tiêu dùng (hàng hoá, điện, than, nước... ).
fumes: smoke, gas, or something similar that smells strongly or is dangerous to breathe inkhói độc
greenhouse gas&nbsp;: a gas that causes the greenhouse effect, especially carbon dioxidekhí nhà kính, đặc biệt là CO2
mining: the process of getting coal and other minerals from under the ground; the industry involved in thisSự khai thác, sự khai mỏ.
natural resources: things such as minerals, forests, coal, etc. that exist in a place and can be used by peopletài nguyên thiên nhiên
precious metal: a very valuable metal such as gold or silverkim loại quý
scale: the size or level of something, especially when this is largequy mô, phạm vi.
carbon neutral: If a person, organization, event, etc. is ca_____n ne___al, it does things such as planting trees to reduce carbon dioxide by the same amount as it produces it.phát thải Carbon trung tính (giúp làm giảm lượng khí thải bằng đúng lượng khí thải mà nó thải ra)
eco-friendly: not harmful to the environmentthân thiện với môi trường
rechargeable: (of a battery) that can be filled again with electrical powerCó thể sạc lại.
recyclable: able to be recycledcó thể tái chế
renewable: (of energy and natural resources) that is replaced naturally or controlled carefully and can therefore be used without the risk of finishing it all(năng lượng) có thể tái tạo, có thể hồi phục lại
precious: valuable or important and not to be wastedQuý, quý giá, quý báu.
sustainable: that can continue or be continued for a long timeCó thể duy trì lâu dài được / Có thể phát triển bền vững
unleaded: petrol/gas that does not contain lead and is therefore less harmful to the environment(về xăng dầu, nhiên liệu) không chứa chì
curb: to control or limit something, especially something badKiềm chế, nén lại; hạn chế.
emit: to send out something such as light, heat, sound, gas, etc.Phát ra (ánh sáng, nhiệt...), bốc ra, tỏa ra (mùi vị, hơi...).
exhaust: to use all of something so that there is none leftLàm kiệt quệ, làm rỗng, làm cạn; dốc hết, dùng hết sạch.
harness: to control and use the force or strength of something to produce power or to achieve somethingkhai thác sức mạnh của một cái gì đó để phục vụ cho mục đích của mình
asset: [ C usually plural ] something valuable belonging to a person or organization(thường ở dạng số nhiều)
bankruptcy: a situation in which a business or a person becomes bankruptSự vỡ nợ, sự phá sản.
bottom line: (business) [countable] the amount of money that is a profit or a loss after everything has been calculatedcon số (doanh thu/thiệt hại) sau cùng
budget: the amount of money you have available to spendNgân sách, ngân quỹ.
client: a customer or someone who receives servicesKhách hàng (của luật sư, cửa hàng... ).
credit rating: a judgement made by a bank, etc. about how likely somebody is to pay back money that they borrow, and how safe it is to lend money to themđánh giá tín dụng (để xem có an toàn để cho vay hay không)
cutback: a reduction in something, made in order to save moneySự cắt giảm để tiết kiệm chi phí
earnings: the amount of money that someone is paid for workingtiền kiếm được, tiền lương.
equity: (formal) a situation in which everyone is treated equallyTính công bằng, tính vô tư.
household name: a famous person that most people know ofngười nổi tiếng (mọi nhà đều biết)
luxury goods: expensive things, such as jewellery and make-up, that are pleasant to have but are not necessaryxa xỉ phẩm
bankrupt: without enough money to pay what you oweVỡ nợ, phá sản.
hands-on: doing something rather than just talking about itThực hành trực tiếp
managerial: connected with the work of a manager(Thuộc) Người quản lý, (thuộc) giám đốc; (thuộc) ban quản trị.
calculated risk: a risk that you consider worth taking because the result, if it is successful, will be so goodrủi ro có thể chấp nhận được vì đáng với kết quả thu về nếu thành công
chair a meeting: to act as the chairman or chairwoman of a meetinglãnh đạo một cuộc họp
golden opportunity: a very good chance to do or achieve somethingcơ hội vàng
keep track of: to have information about what is happening or where somebody/something istheo dõi chặt chẽ một thứ gì đó hoặc ai đó
make a name for yourself: to become famous or respected by a lot of peopletrở nên nổi tiếng, được nhiều người biết đến và kính nể
a win-win situation: something that is good for everyone who is involvedtình huống cả hai bên cùng có lợi
amalgamate: if two organizations am_________te, they join together to form one large organizationTrộn, pha trộn, trộn lẫn, hỗn hợp, hợp nhất (công ty... ).
capital punishment: punishment by death, as ordered by a legal systemán tử hình
community service: work helping people in the local community that somebody does without being paid, either because they want to, or because they have been ordered to by a court as a punishmentlao động công ích (như một dạng hình phạt)
life sentence: the punishment by which somebody spends the rest of their life in prisonÁn tù chung thân.
mugging: the crime of attacking somebody violently, or threatening to do so, in order to steal their money, especially in a public placetội trấn lột
organized crime: criminal organizations that plan and commit crime, or the crimes that are committed by such organizationsphạm tội có tổ chức, có đường dây
peer pressure&nbsp;: the strong influence of a group, especially of children, on members of that group to behave as everyone else doesÁp lực từ bạn bè cùng trang lứa
petty crime: a type of crime that is not considered serious when compared with some other crimesnhững tội vặt vãnh (như trộm đồ siêu thị, móc túi)
robbery: the crime of stealing money or goods from a bank, shop/store, person, etc., especially using violence or threatsSự ăn cướp, vụ ăn cướp (đặc biệt là bằng vũ lực)
vandalism: the crime of intentionally damaging property belonging to other peopleTội phá hoại của công (hoặc tài sản của người khác)
violence: actions or words that are intended to hurt peoplesự hành hung, bạo lực
hostile: very unfriendly or aggressive and ready to argue or fightthái độ thù địch, không thân thiện
lenient: not as strict as expected when punishing somebody or when making sure that rules are obeyedNhân hậu, hiền hậu, khoan dung.
accept the consequences of: chấp nhận, đối mặt với hậu quả của một hành động gì đó
be held responsible for: to be blamed for someone or somethingbị bắt chịu trách nhiệm cho việc gì đó
victim: to be vi___m of: to be injured, damaged or killed by somethinglà nạn nhân (của cái gì đó)
convicted criminal: a person found guilty of a crime and sentenced by a courttội phạm đã bị tuyên án
criminal offence: = crimetội ác, tội trạng, tội hình sự
criminal record: an official record of crimes that a person has committedNghĩa đen: hồ sơ phạm tội. Nếu ai đó có
hardened criminal: someone who has committed many crimes many timesngười đã phạm tội nhiều lần, tái phạm nhiều lần
juvenile crime: criminal activity by people under 18 years oldhành vi phạm tội của người vị thành niên (<18)
underlying causes: những nguyên nhân ẩn, không dễ thấy
jail: j___l somebody (for something) to put somebody in prison(thường bị động) Tống giam, bắt giam.
punish: to make somebody suffer because they have broken the law or done something wrongPhạt, trừng phạt, trừng trị.
bias: a strong feeling in favour of or against one group of people, or one side in an argument, often not based on fair judgementKhuynh hướng, sự thiên về; thành kiến, thiên vị.
broadcaster: a person whose job is presenting or talking on television or radio programmesNgười nói chuyện trên đài phát thanh hoặc đài truyền hình
episode: one part of a story that is broadcast on television or radio in several partstập phim
make the headlines: to be an important item of news in newspapers or on the radio or televisionlên trang nhất (của báo chí), trở thành tin tức được nhiều người quan tâm nhất
paparazzi: the photographers who follow famous people everywhere they go in order to take photographs of them for newspapers and magazinesthợ săn ảnh cho báo chí, hay bám theo người nổi tiếng để săn ảnh
press: newspapers and magazinesBáo chí nói chung
viewer: a person watching televisionNgười xem truyền hình.
biased: showing an unreasonable like or dislike for a person based on personal opinionscó khuynh hướng thiên vị/thành kiến với một trong các bên, không công bằng
eminent: (of people) famous and respected, especially in a particular professionNổi tiếng, xuất sắc.
high-profile: attracting a lot of attention and interest from the public and newspapers, television, etc.:nổi tiếng, thu hút được nhiều sự chú ý của công chúng
prejudiced: having an unreasonable dislike of or preference for somebody/something, especially based on their race, religion, sex, etc.Có thành kiến, biểu lộ thành kiến với thứ gì đó
prominent: very well known and importantĐáng chú ý, nổi bật.Xuất chúng, lỗi lạc, nổi tiếng (người).
subjective: based on your own ideas or opinions rather than facts and therefore sometimes unfairchủ quan (ngược với 'objective' là khách quan)
world-famous: known all over the worldNổi tiếng khắp thế giới.
become famous overnight: trở nên nổi tiếng nhanh chóngtrở nên nổi tiếng chỉ sau một đêm
chief claim to fame: someone's main reason for being well-known or famous.nguyên nhân (chính) khiến ai đó trở nên nổi tiếng
be in the public eye: to be famous and written about in newspapers and magazines and seen on televisiontrở nên nổi tiếng và trở thành chủ đề bàn tán của công chúng
instant celebrities: someone who becomes a celebrity in a very short period of time.chỉ người trở nên nổi tiếng trong một khoảng thời gian ngắn, nhưng rồi sau này không còn ai nhớ đến nữa
media attention: sự quan tâm của giới truyền thông
new-found fame: recently discovered or achieved famesự nổi tiếng vừa mới đạt được
tabloid: (sometimes disapproving) a newspaper of this size with short articles and a lot of pictures and stories about famous people, often thought of as less serious than other newspapersbáo lá cải, chuyên đưa tin về người nổi tiếng
assert: to state clearly and firmly that something is trueXác nhận, khẳng định, quả quyết, quyết đoán.
broadcast: to send out programmes on television or radiophát sóng, phát thanh
contend: to say that something is true, especially in an argumentDám chắc rằng, cho rằng.
gossip: informal talk or stories about other people’s private lives, that may be unkind or not trueChuyện ngồi lê đôi mách, chuyện tầm phào, tin đồn nhảm.
indicate: to show that something is true or existschỉ ra, tỏ ra, ra ý, ngụ ý, biểu lộ, biểu thị.
speculate: to form an opinion about something without knowing all the details or factsSuy đoán, đưa ra ý kiến này ý kiến nọ về, ước đoán.
animation: energy and enthusiasm in the way you look, behave or speakLòng hăng hái, nhiệt tình; sự cao hứng, sự hào hứng.Tính hoạt bát, sinh khí.
culture: the customs and beliefs, art, way of life and social organization of a particular country or groupvăn hóa, nền văn hóa
drama: plays considered as a form of literatureplays and acting generallyNghệ thuật kịch; nghệ thuật tuồng nói chung
echo: a sound that is heard after it has been reflected off a surface such as a wall or a cliffTiếng dội, tiếng vang.
engraving: the art or process of cutting designs on wood, stone, metal, etc.Sự khắc, sự trổ, sự chạm.(Nghĩa bóng) Sự in sâu, sự khắc sâu (vào óc... ).
fiction: a type of literature that describes imaginary people and events, not real ones(tác phẩm) hư cấu, tưởng tượng.
imagination: the ability to create pictures in your mind; the part of your mind that does thisSức tưởng tượng, trí tưởng tượng; sự tưởng tượng.
inspiration: someone or something that gives you ideas for doing somethingNgười truyền cảm hứng, vật truyền cảm hứng.
abominable: extremely unpleasant and causing disgust (synonym: appalling, disgusting)Ghê tởm, kinh tởm.
dismal: causing or showing sadness (synonym: gloomy, miserable)Buồn thảm, tối tăm, ảm đạm, buồn nản, u sầu, phiền muộn.
fictional: not real or true; existing only in storiesGiả tưởng, hư cấu, tưởng tượng.
figurative: (of words and phrases) used not with their basic meaning but with a more imaginative meaning, in order to create a special effect(về ngôn ngữ) cách nói hình tượng, dùng nghĩa bóng (ngược với 'literal' : theo đúng nghĩa đen)
hilarious: extremely funnycực kỳ đáng buồn cười
inspirational: making you feel full of hope or encouragedtruyền cảm hứng; gây cảm hứng.
petrified: extremely frightened (synonym: terrified)cực kỳ sợ (cái gì đó)
spine-chilling: (of a book, film/movie, etc.) frightening in an exciting wayLàm nổi gai ốc; khủng khiếp (nghĩa đen: làm lạnh sống lưng)
talented: having a natural ability to do something wellcó tài, tài năng
tedious: lasting or taking too long and not interesting (synonym: boring)Chán ngắt, tẻ, nhạt nhẽo, thiếu hấp dẫn, làm buồn tẻ.
terrified: very frightenedCảm thấy khiếp sợ, rất kinh hãi.
terrifying: making somebody feel extremely frightenedđáng sợ
thrilling: exciting and enjoyableLàm rùng mình; cảm động, xúc động, hồi hộp, ly kỳ.
it's a matter of taste: something that different people have different opinions abouttùy thuộc vào sở thích của mỗi người
acquire a taste for: to begin to like something, especially a particular kind of food, drink, or experiencebắt đầu thích một cái gì đấy
be in bad taste: causing offence by being insensitive or downright rude to someone else, perhaps by not taking account of their cultural sensibilities.gây xúc phạm bằng cách thiếu để tâm đến ai đó. Ví dụ, mời một người ăn chay nhưng lại mời miếng bánh sandwich thịt lợn thì sẽ là một hành động 'in bad taste'
compose: to write musicsoạn nhạc, sáng tác nhạc
have diverse tastes: có sở thích đa dạng (ví dụ, 'have a diverse music taste' là thích nhiều thể loại nhạc khác nhau)
share the same taste: cùng thích một thứ gì đó
